page.title: 04LATCHINGDON SCHOOL
page.content: Latchingdon school is a small school with 6 classes.Altogether there are about 12 rooms in the whole school.There are 6 teachers and the headmaster Mr Bewick.There are 65 children living in Latchingdon and 121 children living in Maylandsea,and 186 children in the whole school.We have a swimming pool,which is being heated. The oldest part ofthe school was built in 1852,was extended in the 1950's and the newest part was built in 1978. The Maylandsea children come to school by bus.The school is about 3 miles from Maylandsea.We also have a large field with 2 climbing frames and an 80 metre running track,and we have 2 playgrounds,on the small playground we have a curley whirley painted on the tarmac.
